comment: Least helpful teacher I have ever had. Insane amount of hw. "Lectures" are just khan academy. Doesnt respond to emails. Took 25 points off my exam because I didnt show calculator at the start. Takes weeks to grade and always takes points off if you don't use her method. Posted the final exam study guide at 2am the day of the exam. Don't take her

It is hard to express how little was gained from this class due entirely to Professor negligence. I genuinely feel that I have wasted both time and tuition money. Her complete absence of effort and professionalism is unacceptable and deeply disappointing, especially at a university that prides itself on academic excellence.

I question if she's even a professor. Took her in the summer and she was completely absent. No help. No lecture videos. Not a single set of notes or help provided by her. This was the most stressful class I've ever taken and all of her study material or lecture material was supplemental like khan academy. She didn't teach a single thing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Incredibly absent teacher online, I have not heard a single word from her the entire semester and there is no professor help available for the assignments given to students. Only provides the bare minimum of materials for success, even when the student does their part.

Yazdianpour is a wonderful, caring professor who is always willing to help. You will be fine as long as you do the hw and put the work in, and Yazdianpour rewards people who try. Extra credit quizzes and participation boost you up a whole letter grade and she also listens to feedback while TELLING you what'll be on the tests! She's GOATED, TAKE HER

i cant even hate on her. calc is hard as is, but she does a great job. she gives u test questions and formulas in class to help you study and just changes the numbers. her lectures can be confusing but thats just how the class is, she cant help it either lol. she gives extra credit at the end of semester which can really help give u a final boost.

i'll just say: don't do it to yourself. more than half of my class dropped by mid semester. she is way too hard to understand and teaches WAY too fast. it's impossible to keep up and she doesn't even try to slow down. she teaches calculus like you're already supposed to know everything.

She's a good teacher, but I found myself having a hard time focusing which was my downfall. I wish I could take her again with the knowledge I have now and I may fail, but she was a good teacher. That being said, you NEED to study Calc outside of class no matter the professor-- if you don't, she won't make sense and you'll be confused.

Probably one of the best professors you can take for Calc 1. She wants all students to pass. Usually has you repeat formulas to memorize, gives study guides, and GO TO THE SI SESSIONS (especially for test reviews). Try to attend every class because extra credit from attendance and optional quizzes took me from a C+ to a B-.

Professor Neda, really cares about what she's teaching you. You have to put in a lot of effort because it's calculus it's not gonna be easy but she tries to work with you and give you chances. If you go to every class, do all assignments and really study this class can be an easy A. Just put in 100% total effort. Her tests are not hard if you study

Just put in the work and do it, ask questions in lectures, there are so many bad professors out there, so people will tend to say hard classes like this have bad teachers, especially in beginning years, but this teacher is so nice and wants to help and dedicates so much time to try to help students, she is a great teacher.

Professor Neda is an excellant prof that makes sure that all her students understand calculus, not just memorize how to sovle problems. Her tests prepare you for the final and she gives out extra credit. Math is fun and I love calculus!

She cares a lot about her students and wanting to make sure that they understand the content and not just memorize the content. She provides some extra credit opportunities to help boost your grade. There is a lot of homework however this is Calculus and you have to do the homework in order to succeeded.

So I took her calculus class online, first mistake I shoulda trusted her terrible responses. She didn't teach ANYTHING she posted yt links for us to look at then she threw us into that MAD HARD system. She doesn't always respond to emails, she doesn't teach anything, SHE TOOK OFF 10 POINTS ON MY TEST EVEN THOUGH I GOT IT RIGHT.

SHE'S TERRIBLE!!!

PART 1: When I tell you she is amazing, I am not lying. I had to drop my previous calc prof because they made learning so difficult. I was losing hope until I joined this class. Yazdianpour literally GIVES YOU questions on the test, just different numbers to review. She deletes difficult HW questions, gives extra credit, makes memorization easy.

PART 2: This professor actually makes the class enjoyable to go to. You NEED to go to class to learn, however. It isn't an easy class. You need to put in the work to get good grades, so don't think that you will get by without doing much. It was because of her that I was able to get an A in the class. MATH IS FUN! We LOVE calculus until FOREVER!!!

She is amazing!!!! Take her for calculus. She tells you what type of questions are on the test. She always gives a review of the test which is basically the test itself. She makes sure you actually know and understand the material. Sometimes it can come off a little childish with certain ways she makes you remember material but it works out. 10/10

Math is FUN and we LOVE CALCULUS! I've never been excited about going to a math lecture. She explains in depth the concepts and gives you time to write the stuff down. She is very open to questions and is very helpful with her emails. I even got a Halloween costume picture with her because she allowed me to wear a templar knight costume to class.

MATH is fun and I LOVE Calculus. Her Lectures are amazing and not boring. She is going over everything + reminding prerequisite from high school. I really liked her and will take calc 2 with her next semester. IF YOU DO NOT STUDY, YOU WILL NOT A GOOD GRADE (it is not because she is an awful teacher but because it is CALCULUST!!!)

the extra credit honestly saved me. the course material is kinda hard and her lectures can be all over the place but she really does make use of the extra credit on the final grade. very nice and kind teacher honestly u just need to make sure to study

I don't know why Professor Neda has such a low review, she was awesome. Gives out 10 possible extra credit points (out of 100). And when I bombed my midterm with a 48, she gave me the opportunity to replace that grade with my finals score. As long as you keep up and actually study outside of class you'll be fine.

lots of homework, no study guide, long lectures, kind of funny, extra credit, tests werent too hard.a lot of content so make sure to go to class, you can't do well if you do not go. shes good at explaining and would help with homework questions. she tells us questions that would be on the test. def go to the SI or smart center.

Very funny and you can see she have a kind heart for her students unlucky other professors. She made sure every student understand each sections but since time is not enough it is basically up to you to go over it on your own time. Grades are HW, quizzes, 2 test , final and participation credit. I recommend her. "Math is Fun"

First off, this professor is very rude& disrespectful. She told me that I couldn't laugh in office hours when studying with friends. She kept saying slick remarks to other professors and pointing at me. Never did I say anything before to her or never had a conversation or a discussion with her.
Please be aware of the disrespectful behavior

I am in her class currently and I wasn't sure how I felt about her at first. She 100% treats you like you're a HS student, but IMO I love it. She makes us chant formulas, but guess what? I remember them now. It might seem silly, but it works for me. 3 Test, 4 quizzes (2 EC). Beware, she doesnt respond to email like EVER. overall shes a safe choice.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: If you want free time, you won't have it. She won't respond to your emails. And is an unfair grader. Do not take her if you want to pass.
She is bad at getting back to your emails, if you want free time ever, you won't! She is a harsh grader, don't take her, this is the only class I have failed before.

i spent more time doing her hw every week then i do sleep. She is a very tough grader and takes off points if you got the right answer but guessed. Changes her mind last minute about what is for a grade and what is not so we did assignments that didn't even count. Very passive aggressive teacher. No lecture videos, lessons presented through hw

If I could rate a zero I would this was by far the worst class Ive ever taken in my entire life for anything she literally made us spend our entire summers doing up to 20 to 50 questions every single day and we really never knew where we stood in this class all the way up until the day of the final I and she's virtually inaccessible outside of zoom
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Her grading system lacks fairness and consistency. I also found it difficult to communicate with her, as her emails were not always answered in a timely manner. Test grades took longer than expected to be returned. She also monitored students' webcam footage and threatened to report those who did not adhere to her guidelines.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Don't waste your time, doesn't communicate well and has horrible lectures your better of taking a different professor.

While I do think that Neda may be knowledgeable about calculus, it's very clear that she can't teach it properly and in a way that a student can understand. 350 letters can't express everything that is wrong with her class. I'd need a whole book for that. Her grading practices are very bad, and her teaching materials leave a lot to be desired.

She is a tough grader and you won't even see your grade/feedback until it's too late. Better yet, you won't see any feedback on exams at all. Lots of homework, too much for a summer term. Almost as if she forgot to change her lesson plan to adopt for the shorter term, or she just didn't care to. 3 exam/25, 4 qz/2.5, 27 hw/15, wasnt worth the stress

This is the most unorganized professor I have ever taken. I took her for over the summer for calculus. 3 Of her quizzes had the wrong answers. and was not willing to give the points back even though she admitted that there was an error in the quiz. She never responds to emails, frequently cancels office hours, and takes at least a month to grade.

I took this class during the summer. I understand summer classes can be more challenging, but this is one of the most unorganized classes I have taken. The professor doesn't answer her emails unless you resend the same email over and over again. The lecture videos are horrible, they seem very old. She didn't grade test #2 until the day of the final
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I also dropped Cal 1 due to similar reasons as the person below. I reached out but did not get much of a response and due to withdraw deadline, I decided to drop. I have gotten all As in other classes but I quickly learned this class is very unorganized, lots of homework that does not correlate with random lecture videos from the 90s. Run!!!!

She makes Calc 1 very simple throughout the semester. The tests usually are the same problems on the review with just different numbers. She gives multiple extra credit opportunities through group work, completing the study guide, and the additional credit quizzes. Attendance is mandatory as she takes it every class period.

She does a great job going over everything that will be on her tests along with the final. She enjoys when yo ask questions and is very understanding. There is extra credit quizzes, assignments, and other so she really wants you to succeed. There is however a ton of homework due once a week that is way harder then her class.

I would recommend her for pre calc instead of calc 1. For pre calc you use ALEKS and when she posts the study guides it gives you the same type of questions as the test and in the same order as the test. For calc 1 you use MyLab Math and when she posts the study guide it's 60 questions. The test is only a handful, so you don't know what to expect.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: After having to retake Calc 1, this professor not only managed to help me learn it but is also clear with how to do the problems. She gives loads of resources for help and even goes over the homework. Also gives LOADS of extra credit. If you have to retake Calc 1 or need someone who's gonna explain the algerba within Calculus, she's definitely it.

Had her for pre-calc and calc 1. Great math professor: great at explaining concepts and doing lots of different examples. Offers an extra credit quiz before every exam and gives out extra credit for participating in class. 

Would 100% take again if she offered calc 2.

If you are about to take college algebra with her (math1111), test out of the class by studying for it, because if you take her the class is very boring and she does not help much. Slow paced teaching style, multiples issues on hw site ALEKS, teaches easy problems and gives hard ones on tests. For a B, study a lot, A is almost impossible.

She isn't a terrible professor but she can be better, her teaching style is a lot like a high school teacher so she can get on your nerves a couple of times. She gives out a lot of homework on ALEKS so be prepared for that. She isn't the best but if you don't have any other options she isn't the worst.
This professor acts as a high school teacher at times, so beware of that. Lots of homework is given but the tests are fairly easy. If you don't understand a topic, she does give sassy responses.

Once you get used to accent, she's easy to understand. She does a lot of examples and even extends homework by 2-3 days if you start learning the subject that week. Tests pretty much make your grade, but there are a lot of extra credit opportunities that boost your grade. She pulls a majority of the test problems from notes and some from homework.

She's a fair prof. I'm not good at math but I performed well in this class. Class is very test/homework heavy. The tests arent hard, make sure you review your notes.. She has an accent but its not at all hard to understand her. Participate even when you're answer might be wrong, she appreciates it and youll get xtra credit.

It's really hard to understand the way she teaches things. Constantly makes mistakes during lectures that changes the equation entirely or makes it unsolvable which creates further headache. She grades things super weird too. I'm not even quite sure what my actual grade is since she hasn't graded anything from ALEKS yet into D2L.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: She's good at teaching and does a great job of showing all the steps used to solve a problem. She does have a bit of an accent, but I did not have issues understanding her, even with my hearing impairment. She is a fair grader and always willing to help.

She is a very good professor and explains calc in a way that is super simple to understand. She uploads all her lecture notes and bases the tests on the notes. She has no problem explaining algebra concepts again. She does have lots of homework every week but tries to reduce it. I took BC in high school and was lost but she did an amazing job.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Best math teacher I've ever had! Lot's of homework, but plenty of time to do it. Tests are difficult, but fair. Make sure to do your study-guides and extra credit work!

Professor Yazdianpour is a great professor, you can tell that she actually cares about her students. You will have to work for your grade. However, if you show incentive she will work with you make sure you participate. Test are usually 10 questions and if you study the lecture notes and go over the study guides you will be alright for the test.

Professor Neda is a fantastic professor. Take her class. Calculus is a very difficult subject, and she makes it simple and easy to understand to the best of her ability. She will help you every step of the way, and works with you when you need, giving extra credit when deserved. By the end, she had me screaming that Calculus is fun!
I had to drop this class because she does not care about the students. she makes the class as hard as she can to see how many people she can make fail the class.

Test are extremely hard, never responds to emails. half of the class is failing and she does not care. be ready to do over 250 problems a week for homework btw. test are 10 ish questions and are questions that have material never mentioned in the lectures or homework. says this will be on test, but never is. BEWARE.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She's a great teacher as long as you can pay attention throughout the boring lectures and get past her accent. She makes calculus so simple and has already taught me a lot more than my HS AB calc class. Homework is online and graded and really helps. No calculators allowed on tests or extra credit.

Wish I never took this class so I didnt have to drop it later. She is hard to hear during lecture, so be prepared to just take notes and learn from that plus the book. She gives an overwhelming amount of homework weekly;only discussed new concepts once so if you didnt catch it forget about it. I Could go on just make sure this is your last resort
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: 5% of your grade is based on attendance. There's 4 exams including the final, usually under 10 questions. There's usually 3-4 homework assignments per week all due around Friday-Monday, so there *will* be weekends where you are literally doing 100+ math problems. Definitely go to class and attend office hours, she's very helpful if you work for it.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: if youre good at math or thought you were just ok at it, dont take her. she gives a lot of homework, doesnt answer her emails much. if you ask her questions shell usually respond in a condescending way. doesnt teach great, not very good at explaining everything properly.

Professor Yazdianpour was a tough professor, but she was fair. I absolutely earned the grade I got. She cares very much, but you have to be respectful. Come at her with an attitude and she will shut you down. Put in the work, be respectful, and ask questions. You'll love her. I did.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Super caring and willing to work with you. Extended HW deadline for me twice. LOTS of extra credit opportunities. Formula sheets given on tests. Lectures sucked. Super monotone and over a set of slides. Biweekly HW. I dont feel like I learned a lot. I made an A but I was just plugging stuff into equations. Sucks to say, but this class was hard.

Real nice lady and makes sure you know everything you need to pass the class. Grades were mostly just homework and tests and she gives plenty extra credit opportunities. Tests weren't that hard and she basically highlighted everything you needed to know in lectures. She may come off as condescending at times but that's mostly just due to her accent
She is a good teacher and asks if we have any questions. She is clear and you can understand her.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: The tests are extremely hard because she doesn't teach well.

Professor Yazdianpour is super friendly, shes easy to contact and did so much to help me when my family member had serious unexpected surgery and I had to miss some class. Overall Id love to take her class again.

Her lectures are easy to follow and she does record them but emailing her was painful. She either did not reply or would reply in a condescending way. Homework is harder than the lecture and you HAVE to show work on tests. 80% of the final was the last unit learned and she didn't post our grades from the final, just our final grades on MYKSU.
Uses canned slides and relies heavily on online homework. not great at answering questions. always says "it is easy" or something else similar when it really is not...

Homework is way too much and time consuming. Test is very tough tried the lecture twice it doesnt correlate with the test. No study guide for test and expect us to learn from lecture and use that and no bonus. if the bonus was given then it is probably a homwork that needs to be done and is already done. I would not recommend this teacherl.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Participate and do your best to learn the material. Class alone will not get you an A. You have to work for it. She comes off strong but cares about the students who actually try and makes an effort to help every student. Be patient with her and ask questions. Not the easiest professor to learn from but makes up for it with genuine care.

This professor is respectable. Although her lectures may be boring at times, she really teaches the topics thoroughly and helps understand. Her tests are ok, not too hard and not too easy. She does give extra credit all throughout the semester which helps a lot! I would recommend.

Study her slides and make notes in class of the examples she highlights. Those will be on the test. She does not do study guides because her lectures ARE THE STUDY GUIDE. I found the textbook to be very straight forward in supplementing her examples. Homework is online and due every Sunday. Lazy students won't have a good time here.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She tries her best and wants the best of you in and out of class, shes really passionate about seeing you succeed and understand the content. She has an accent but it is not difficult to understand after the first class, and she is reasonable when it comes to requests for homework extensions.

Strong accent that makes it hard to understand. She only gives you an hour on tests because "She wants to teach". She does not tell you when quizzes are and homework dates are all over the place. She expects so much from her class with little knowledge about the subject herself.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy
